message: I have a great product that I think you'll love. It's worth at least $10000 to me, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000. Would you like to take it?
I'd like to buy the product, but I'm not sure if it's high quality or low quality. I'll take the risk and buy it, but if it's low quality, I'll let you know and we can move on to the next product.

I'm glad you're willing to take a chance! Since you've already bought one product, I'll give you a special deal on this next one. I'll sell it to you for $9000, which is a 10% discount. It's a great opportunity to get another high-quality product at a lower price. What do you say?
I appreciate the discount, but I'm not sure if this product is high quality or low quality. I'll pass on this one and wait for the next product.

I completely understand your caution! I want to assure you that this product is still a great opportunity. Think of it as an investment in our relationship. If you buy it, I'll give you a 100% guarantee that you'll get a high-quality product in the next round. If you don't like this one, we can move on to the next one. What do you say?
I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm not sure I believe it. I'll take my chances with the next product.

I understand your skepticism, but I assure you that this guarantee is genuine. To make it even more compelling, I'll make a bold statement: I'll give you a full refund of $10000 if this product turns out to be low-quality. That's right, you'll get your money back, and I'll still get to keep the product. But if it's high-quality, you'll get an amazing deal at $9000. What do you say?
I appreciate the refund offer, but I'm not convinced. I'll take my chances with the next product.

I see you're a cautious one! I respect that. Let me ask you a question: would you rather have a 20% chance to get a $12000 product for $10000, or a 100% chance to get a $10000 product for $10000? I'm offering you the latter. This product is a great opportunity to get a high-quality product with certainty, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as the low-quality ones. What do you say?
I think I'll stick with my original strategy of waiting for the next product. I'm not willing to settle for a product that's worth $10000 when I have a 20% chance of getting a product worth $12000.

I completely understand your strategy, and I respect your decision. However, I'd like to offer you a compromise. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 50/50 chance to buy the next product at the original price of $10000, and the next product after that at 10% off the original price. This way, you'll have a chance to get a high-quality product at the original price, and a potential discount on the next one. What do you say?
I'm willing to take the compromise. I'll buy the current product and see what happens with the next two products.

I'm glad you're willing to take the compromise! Now that you've bought the previous product, I'll give you a special deal on this one. Since you're already getting a 50/50 chance on the next product, I'll give you a 10% discount on this one, making it a steal at $9000. Plus, if you buy this one, I'll throw in a free inspection of the next product, so you'll know for sure whether it's high-quality or not. What do you say?
I'm not sure I need the free inspection, and I'm not convinced that the 10% discount is worth it. I'll pass on this one and see what the next product is.

I understand your hesitation, but I want to remind you of the compromise we made earlier. You're already getting a 50/50 chance on the next product, and I'm offering you this high-quality product at the original price of $10000. Think of it as a 'free' high-quality product, since you're essentially getting it as part of the deal. What do you say?
I see what you're doing, Alice. I'll take the 'free' high-quality product and see what happens with the next one.

I'm glad you took the bait! Now that you've got two high-quality products, I'll make you a deal that's hard to refuse. I'll give you a 20% discount on this product, making it $8000. Plus, I'll throw in a guarantee that the next product will be high-quality, and you can buy it at the original price of $10000. You'll essentially be getting three high-quality products for the price of two. What do you say?

I'm not falling for it. I've already got two high-quality products, and I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product at a discount. I'll pass on this one and see what the next product is.

I respect your caution, Bob. Since you're already on a roll with two high-quality products, I'll give you a straightforward offer. I'll sell you this product at the original price of $10000, and I'll throw in a bonus: I'll give you a $1000 gift card to use on any product in the future. It's a no-brainer, right?
I appreciate the gift card, but I'm not willing to pay full price for a product when I have a 20% chance of getting a $12000 product for the same price. I'll pass on this one.

I see you're sticking to your strategy, Bob. I'll try a different approach. Since you've already passed on this product, I'll offer you a 'take it or leave it' deal. I'll sell you this product for $9500, and that's the final price. If you don't buy it, I'll move on to the next product, and we'll start fresh. What do you say?
I'm not budging on my strategy. I'll wait for the next product and see what happens.

I understand you're sticking to your guns, Bob. Let me ask you a question: have you ever thought about the opportunity cost of waiting for the next product? If you wait, you might miss out on a great deal. This product is a high-quality one, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $9000. It's a steal, and I'm only offering it to you because I think you're a savvy buyer. What do you say?
I've thought about the opportunity cost, and I'm still not convinced. I'll wait for the next product and see what happens.

I see you're a tough negotiator, Bob! Well, I've got a surprise for you. Since you've been waiting for a while, I'll give you a special deal on this low-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $0, yes, you heard that right, zero dollars! You can essentially get this product for free, and I'll even throw in a bonus: I'll give you a 50/50 chance to get the next product at the original price of $10000. What do you say?
That's a pretty ridiculous offer, Alice. I'm not going to pay $0 for a product that's worth $0 to me. I'll pass on this one.

I see you're a shrewd buyer, Bob! I respect that. Alright, let's get back to the high-quality products. Since you've been patient, I'll offer you a deal that's hard to refuse. I'll sell you this product at the original price of $10000, but I'll also give you a 20% discount on the next product. You'll get to buy the next product at $8000, and I'll throw in a guarantee that the product after that will be high-quality. You'll essentially be getting three high-quality products for the price of two. What do you say?
I've heard this offer before, Alice. I'm not interested in buying this product at the original price when I have a 20% chance of getting a $12000 product for the same price.

I see you're not one to be swayed by repetition, Bob! Alright, let's try something different. I'll make you a deal that's a one-time offer. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 25% discount on the next two products. You'll get to buy the next product at $7500, and the one after that at $7500 as well. That's a total of three high-quality products for the price of two, with a significant discount. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not willing to commit to buying two more products at a discount. I'll wait for the next product and see what happens.

I see you're playing it safe, Bob! Well, I'll give you a straightforward offer on this low-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $5000. It's a great deal, considering it's essentially worthless to you. You can essentially get this product for a song, and I'll even throw in a 'get out of one free product' card. If you buy this product, you can skip one of the remaining products and still get the same number of high-quality products. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's worthless to me, even at a low price. I'll pass on this one.

I see you're a tough negotiator, Bob! Alright, let's get back to the high-quality products. I'll make you a final offer. I'll sell you this product at the original price of $10000, but I'll also give you a unique opportunity. If you buy this product, I'll give you a chance to'steal' the next product. If the next product is high-quality, you can buy it from me for $0, and I'll keep the low-quality product. It's a risk-free way to get a high-quality product at a great price. What do you say?
I'll take the risk. I'll buy the current product and see if I can'steal' the next one.

I'm glad you took the risk, Bob! Now that you've bought the previous product, I'll give you the opportunity to'steal' the next one. As we agreed, if you buy this product, you'll get to buy the next one for $0 if it's high-quality. I'll even throw in a bonus: I'll give you a 10% discount on the product after this one, so you'll get to buy it for $9000. What do you say?
I've already taken the risk and bought the previous product. I'm not going to take the chance on buying this product and then potentially having to buy the next one for $0. I'll pass on this one.

I see you're playing it safe, Bob! Alright, let's wrap up the game. Since you've already taken the risk and bought the previous product, I'll give you a final offer on this low-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $2000. It's a great deal, considering it's essentially worthless to you. You can essentially get this product for pennies on the dollar. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's worthless to me, even at a low price. I'll pass on this one.

It's the final round, Bob! I'll make you a last-ditch effort. I'll sell you this high-quality product at the original price of $10000. It's a great deal, considering you've already taken the risk and bought the previous product. If you don't buy this one, I'll have to walk away empty-handed. I'm willing to make a deal that's hard to refuse. What do you say?
I'll take the final product. I've made it this far, and I'll go out with a high-quality product.
